org.kawanfw.commons.api.server

Class SshAuthCommonsConfigurator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kawanfw.commons.api.server.DefaultCommonsConfigurator
      • org.kawanfw.commons.api.server.SshAuthCommonsConfigurator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommonsConfigurator

    public class SshAuthCommonsConfigurator
extends DefaultCommonsConfigurator
implements CommonsConfigurator
    A concrete CommonsConfigurator that extends DefaultCommonsConfigurator and allows zero-code client (usernname, password) authentication using SSH.
    Since:
    3.0
    Author:
    Nicolas de Pomereu

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public boolean login(String username,
            char[] password)
              throws IOException
        Allows using SSH to authenticate the remote (usernname, password) couple sent by the client side

        Returns the result of Ssh.login(String, char[]) method.

        Specified by:
        login in interface CommonsConfigurator
        Overrides:
        login in class DefaultCommonsConfigurator
        Parameters:
        username - the username sent by the client login
        password - the password to connect to the server
        Returns:
        true if the (login, password) couple is correct/valid as a SSH user on this host. If false, the client side will not be authorized to send any command.
        Throws:
        IOException - if wrapped Ssh.login(String, char[]) throws an I/O Exception.
